intro: Mallotus philippensis var. mengliangensis, commonly known as the Mengliangensis Mallot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark and leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
